intro: Hieracium levicaule, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are usually lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium levicaule is often found in grasslands, meadows, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
